question: 邸内
sourceMnemonic: The land <kanji>inside</kanji> of a <kanji>residence</kanji> is called the <vocabulary>grounds</vocabulary> or the <vocabulary>premises</vocabulary>. Only really big residences have land inside them big enough to be called the "grounds" though.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
